meanings.definition: A beta-blocker medication used to treat high blood pressure and prevent heart attacks.
meanings.sent1: My doctor prescribed propranolol to help lower my blood pressure.
meanings.sent2: She takes propranolol every day to keep her heart healthy.
meanings.sent3: The propranolol bottle danced on the shelf, promising a healthier heart.
meanings.sent4: His heart felt like a racecar until propranolol slowed it down to a gentle stroll.
meanings.sent5: Propranolol is like a shield, protecting the heart from harm.

meanings.definition: The generic name for a drug that is also sold under the brand name Inderal.
meanings.sent1: The pharmacist recommended propranolol as a cost-effective alternative to Inderal.
meanings.sent2: She asked her doctor if she could switch from Inderal to propranolol.
meanings.sent3: The propranolol label winked at her, revealing its secret identity as Inderal.
meanings.sent4: Propranolol is the chameleon of medications, transforming from generic to brand name.
meanings.sent5: In the world of drugs, propranolol is the unsung hero, quietly saving lives.
